bite.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to use your teeth to cut, crush, or chew something
bite.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The dog bit him and made his hand bleed.
I wish I could stop biting my nails.
She paused uncertainly, biting her lip.
She bit into a croissant and took a sip of coffee.
An adult conger eel can easily bite through a man’s leg.
Nina pushed her fist into her mouth and bit down hard.
a man whose arm was bitten off by an alligator
bite.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to injure someone by making a hole in their skin
bite.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The dog’s been badly bitten by fleas.
bite.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: if an object bites into a surface, it presses firmly into it and does not move or slip
bite.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The hooves of the galloping horses had bitten deep into the soft earth.
He wore boots that bit into the ice.
bite.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to start to have an unpleasant effect
bite.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: The new tobacco taxes have begun to bite.
The recession is biting into the music industry.
bite.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: to believe what someone tells you, or to buy something they are selling, especially when they have persuaded you to do this
bite.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: The new camcorders were withdrawn after consumers failed to bite.
bite.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: if a fish bites, it takes food from a hook and so gets caught
bite.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: The fish just aren’t biting today.
bite.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: bite
to use your teeth to cut, crush, or chew something
The dog bit me!
I sometimes bite my fingernails when I’m nervous.
He bit into the apple.
chew
to keep biting something that is in your mouth
Helen was chewing a piece of gum.
He was chewing on a cigar.
gnaw
if an animal gnaws something, it bites it repeatedly
The dog was in the yard gnawing on a bone.
nip somebody/give somebody a nip
to give someone or something a small sharp bite
When I took the hamster out of his cage, he nipped me.
nibble
to take a lot of small bites from something
A fish nibbled at the bait.
She sat at her desk, nibbling her sandwich.
sink your teeth into somebody/something
to bite someone or something with a lot of force, so that your teeth go right into them
The dog sank its teeth into my leg.
He sank his teeth into the steak.
chomp on something
to bite something and chew it in a noisy way
The donkey was chomping on a carrot.
He was chomping away on big slice of toast.
sting
if an insect stings you, it makes a very small hole in your skin. You use sting about bees, wasps, and scorpions, and bite about mosquitoes, ants, spiders, and snakes
She stepped on a wasps’ nest and must have been stung at least 20 times.
bite.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: the act of cutting or crushing something with your teeth
bite.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Antonio devoured half his burger in one bite.
Her body was covered in bite marks.
She picked up the sandwich and took a bite.
take/have a bite (of something/out of something)
Can I have a bite of your apple?
take/have a bite (of something/out of something)
Some fish can give you a nasty bite.
bite.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a small hole made where an animal or insect has bitten you
bite.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The infection is passed by the bite of a mosquito.
bite.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: Goat’s cheese adds extra bite to any pasta dish.
bite.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: There was no mistaking the approach of winter; he could feel its bite.
bite.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: a special quality in a performance, piece of writing etc that makes its arguments very effective and likely to persuade people
bite.translation[1].definitions[4].examp: The film gains incisive bite from Sellers’ performance as the union chief.
bite.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: when a fish takes the food from a hook
bite.translation[1].definitions[5].examp: Sometimes I sit for hours and never get a bite.
bite.translation[1].definitions[6].defin: the way that a person or animal’s top and bottom teeth touch when their mouth is closed
bite.translation[1].definitions[6].examp: Our dentist said that Emmy should wear a brace to improve her bite.
